data.body:
On the right is the graph of $f(x)$. For each of the given points determine the value of $f(a)$, 

 $\lim_{x \to a^{-}}  f(x)$, $\lim_{x \to a^{+}}  f(x)$, and $\lim_{x \to a} f(x)$.
data.prompt: If any of the quantities do not exist clearly explain why.

data.body: For the following equation:
For the function $f(x) = 4x^{7} - 18x^{3} + 9$ answer each of the following questions.
options: Write down the equation(s) of any horizontal asymptotes for the function.

data.body: Given the function
data.prompt: Evaluate the following limits, if they exist.

data.title: Multi line text with embeded Latex
data.body: Example:
data.equation:
This is inline latex: $f(x) = \sum_{i=0}^{n} \frac{a_i}{1+x}$

This is block level latex:

$$
c = \pm\sqrt{a^2 + b^2}
$$

This is inline latex with displayMode: $$f(x) = \sum_{i=0}^{n} \frac{a_i}{1+x}$$ and here is a very long text that should be in the same line.

The relationship between the height and the side length of an equilateral triangle is:

\[ \text{Height} = \frac{\sqrt{3}}{2} \times \text{Side Length} \]

\[ \text{X} = \frac{1}{2} \times \text{Y} \times \text{Z} = \frac{1}{2} \times 9 \times \frac{\sqrt{3}}{2} \times 9 = \frac{81\sqrt{3}}{4} \]

The basic form of the Taylor series is:

\[f(x) = f(a) + f'(a)(x-a) + \frac{f''(a)}{2!}(x-a)^2 + \frac{f'''(a)}{3!}(x-a)^3 + \cdots\]

where \(f(x)\) is the function to be expanded, \(a\) is the expansion point, \(f'(a)\), \(f''(a)\), \(f'''(a)\), etc., are the first, second, third, and so on derivatives of the function at point \(a\), and \(n!\) denotes the factorial of \(n\).

In particular, when \(a=0\), this expansion is called the Maclaurin series.

For the function $f(x) = \frac{8-x^{3}}{x^{2}-4}$ answer each of the following questions.
data.prompt: (a) Evaluate the function at the following values of  x  compute (accurate to at least 8 decimal places).
data.followUpPrompt: (b) Use the information from (a) to estimate the value of $\lim_{x \to 2} \frac{8-x^{3}}{x^{2}-4} $

For the function $f(x) = 3(x + 2)^{2}$  and the point  P  given by  $x = -3$  answer each of the following questions.
data.prompt: For the points  Q  given by the following values of  x  compute (accurate to at least 8 decimal places) the slope,  m P Q , of the secant line through points  P  and  Q .
data.followUpPrompt: Use the information from (a) to estimate the slope of the tangent line to $f(x)  at  x = -3$  and write down the equation of the tangent line.

data.body: Which numbers are prime?
If you invest $1000 at an annual interest rate of 5% for 2 years, how much will you have at the end? How about after 10 years?
For the function $f(x) = 4(x + 1)^{2}$ and the point $P$ given by $x = -1$ answer each of the following questions.
data.prompt: (a) For the points $Q$ given by the following values of $x$ compute (accurate to at least 8 decimal places) the slope, $mPQ$, of the secant line through points $P$ and $Q$.
data.followUpPrompt: (b) Use the information from (a) to estimate the slope of the tangent line to $f(x)$ at $x = -1$ and write down the equation of the tangent line.
